response.overview: 2006 Issued Digitally Remastered Collection of Tracks from the Band that Emerged from the Split of the First Lineup of the Human League in 1981. Ian Craig Marsh and Martyn Ware, Along with Singer Glenn Gregory Became a Political Alternative Phil Oakey's Newfound Crew. Their First Single "(We Don't Need No Fascist) Groove Thang" Instantly Zipped Up the Charts and the Debut Album "Penthouse and Pavement" Did the Same. But it was the Single "Let Me Go" Release Just Prior to their Second Outing "The Luxury Gap" that Firmly Established their Chart Presence for the Next Few Years. This Collection Presents all the Band's Hits on the CD Portion of this Set and their Promotional Videos on the Dvd (Pal Format) Assembled Together for One Very Special, Definitive Package!
response.title: Heaven 17 Greatest Hits
